<a id="TileSetSource"></a>

# TileSetSource

**Inherits:** [Resource](Resource.md) **\<** [RefCounted](RefCounted.md) **\<** [Object](Object.md)

**Inherited By:** [TileSetAtlasSource](TileSetAtlasSource.md), [TileSetScenesCollectionSource](TileSetScenesCollectionSource.md)

Exposes a set of tiles for a [TileSet](TileSet.md) resource.

<!-- classref-introduction-group -->

## Description

Exposes a set of tiles for a [TileSet](TileSet.md) resource.

Tiles in a source are indexed with two IDs, coordinates ID (of type Vector2i) and an alternative ID (of type int), named according to their use in the [TileSetAtlasSource](TileSetAtlasSource.md) class.

Depending on the TileSet source type, those IDs might have restrictions on their values, this is why the base **TileSetSource** class only exposes getters for them.

You can iterate over all tiles exposed by a TileSetSource by first iterating over coordinates IDs using [get_tiles_count()](TileSetSource.md#TileSetSource_method_get_tiles_count) and [get_tile_id()](TileSetSource.md#TileSetSource_method_get_tile_id), then over alternative IDs using [get_alternative_tiles_count()](TileSetSource.md#TileSetSource_method_get_alternative_tiles_count) and [get_alternative_tile_id()](TileSetSource.md#TileSetSource_method_get_alternative_tile_id).

\ **Warning:** **TileSetSource** can only be added to one TileSet at the same time. Calling [TileSet.add_source()](TileSet.md#TileSet_method_add_source) on a second [TileSet](TileSet.md) will remove the source from the first one.

<!-- classref-reftable-group -->

<!-- classref-descriptions-group -->

## Method Descriptions

<a id="TileSetSource_method_get_alternative_tile_id"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[int](int.md) **get_alternative_tile_id**\ (\ atlas_coords\: [Vector2i](Vector2i.md), index\: [int](int.md)\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#TileSetSource_method_get_alternative_tile_id)

Returns the alternative ID for the tile with coordinates ID `atlas_coords` at index `index`.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TileSetSource_method_get_alternative_tiles_count"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[int](int.md) **get_alternative_tiles_count**\ (\ atlas_coords\: [Vector2i](Vector2i.md)\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#TileSetSource_method_get_alternative_tiles_count)

Returns the number of alternatives tiles for the coordinates ID `atlas_coords`.

For [TileSetAtlasSource](TileSetAtlasSource.md), this always return at least 1, as the base tile with ID 0 is always part of the alternatives list.

Returns -1 if there is not tile at the given coords.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TileSetSource_method_get_tile_id"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[Vector2i](Vector2i.md) **get_tile_id**\ (\ index\: [int](int.md)\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#TileSetSource_method_get_tile_id)

Returns the tile coordinates ID of the tile with index `index`.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TileSetSource_method_get_tiles_count"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[int](int.md) **get_tiles_count**\ (\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#TileSetSource_method_get_tiles_count)

Returns how many tiles this atlas source defines (not including alternative tiles).

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TileSetSource_method_has_alternative_tile"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[bool](bool.md) **has_alternative_tile**\ (\ atlas_coords\: [Vector2i](Vector2i.md), alternative_tile\: [int](int.md)\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#TileSetSource_method_has_alternative_tile)

Returns if the base tile at coordinates `atlas_coords` has an alternative with ID `alternative_tile`.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TileSetSource_method_has_tile"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[bool](bool.md) **has_tile**\ (\ atlas_coords\: [Vector2i](Vector2i.md)\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#TileSetSource_method_has_tile)

Returns if this atlas has a tile with coordinates ID `atlas_coords`.
